trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for data pager field types, which represent a navigation control for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager"></xref> control.
The DataPagerField class serves as the base class for all data pager field types.
Data pager fields are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to represent a navigation control.
Use the classes that are derived from DataPagerField to select which type of pager is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The following table lists available data pager field types.

|Pager field type|Description| |----------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField>|Lets users navigate through data pages one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField>|Lets users select a page by page number.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField>|Lets page developers create a custom paging UI.| You can derive from the DataPagerField class to create additional pager field types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> class.
Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class is abstract, you cannot create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object directly.
This constructor is typically called by the constructor of a derived class to initialize the properties that are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.
Creates a copy of the current object that is derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref>.

The CloneField method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.CloneFields%2A> method to create a copy of the current object that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField>.

To create a copy of the current object, the CloneField method first creates a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CreateField%2A> method.
Then it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CopyProperties%2A> method to copy the property values of the current object.
A copy of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.

Copies the properties of the current object derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object.

The CopyProperties method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method to copy the properties of the current object derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object created by the method.
The object to copy the properties of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
object to.
When overridden in a derived class, creates the user interface (UI) controls for the data pager field object and adds them to the specified container.

The CreateDataPagers method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.CreatePagerFields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create the UI controls for the data pager field.
The container that is used to store the controls.
The index of the first record on the page.
The maximum number of items on a single page.
The total number of items.
The index of the data pager field in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields*> collection.
When overridden in a derived class, creates an empty object that is derived <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref>.

The CreateField method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method to create an empty object that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField>.
The current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object is copied into the empty object.
An empty object that is derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref>.
Gets a reference to the data pager that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object is associated with.
The DataPager reference is internally set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.OnInsertComplete%2A> method is called.
The object that contains the data pager field.
Creates a URL that contains a query string field that has the specified page number.

The GetQueryStringNavigateUrl method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to create the target URL for each button of the pager field.
The target URL includes a query string field that contains a name/value pair.
The name is the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, and the value represents the value of `pageNumber`.
The target page number.
The target URL.
When overridden in a derived class, handles events that occur in the data pager field object.

The HandleEvent method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnBubbleEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to handle events that occur in the pager field object.
The event data.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Restores view-state information that was saved previously.

The LoadViewState method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method during a previous page request.
This method is primarily used by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The saved view-state values for the control.
Raises the <xref uid="langword_csharp_FieldChanged" name="FieldChanged" href=""></xref> event.
The OnFieldChanged method raises an event that indicates that the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object has changed.
Changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A> property cause this event to be raised.
Changes to properties in derived types also raise this event when state changes occur.
The OnFieldChanged method enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the query string field has been evaluated.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields use the QueryStringHandled property to determine whether the query string field has been evaluated.
If QueryStringHandled is `false`, the pager field class processes the page number that is contained in the query string field.
It also updates the page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The pager field class uses this property only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property is not an empty string or `null`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the query string field has been evaluated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the value of the query string field from the URL of the request.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not an empty string or `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control uses the HTTP GET command to navigate through the pages.
A query string field that consists of a name/value pair is added to the URL of the page.
The QueryStringValue property retrieves the value of the query string field from the URL of the request.
The QueryStringValue property contains the requested page number.

This property is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to evaluate the index of the first record for the page of data requested.
The page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control are then updated.
The value of the query string field.
Saves the changes that were made to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object's view state.
If there is no view state associated with the object, the SaveViewState method returns `null`.
The SaveViewState method is primarily used by control developers.
The view-state changes for the control.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes.
The IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState interface property uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property.
This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Restores view-state information that was saved previously.
The IStateManager.LoadViewState interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.LoadViewState%2A> method.
This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.
The saved view-state values for the control.
Saves the changes that were made to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object's view state.
The IStateManager.SaveViewState interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method.
This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.
The view-state changes for the control.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so that they can be stored in the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.ViewState*> property and persisted across requests for the same page.
The IStateManager.TrackViewState interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.TrackViewState%2A> method.
This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so that they can be stored in the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.ViewState*> property and persisted across requests for the same page.

The TrackViewState method internally sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property to `true` and invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> method for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.ViewState%2A> object.

Gets a dictionary of state information that enables you to save and restore the view state of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> object across multiple requests for the same page.
A data pager field's view state is the accumulation of all its property values.
To preserve values across HTTP requests for the same page, ASP.NET server controls use this property to store the property values.
The values are stored in an HTML hidden input element on the page.
For more information, see [ASP.NET View State Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
By default, view state is enabled for all server controls, but there are circumstances when you might want to disable it.
For more information, see [ASP.NET Performance Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see [Collections and Data Structures](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An object that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> view-state information.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a data pager field is rendered.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField"></xref> is rendered; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
